alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Carroll County through 530 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tamworth, or 8 miles northeast of Moultonborough, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moultonborough, Ossipee, Effingham, Tamworth, Sandwich, Wolfeboro, Madison, Freedom, Albany and Tuftonboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
